hints.content:
The equation $y = \dfrac{y_0}{x_0}x$ describes every point on the medial ray.

The point where the rays intersect is $(x_1, y_1)$. Since this point is on the medial ray, it must satisfy this equation.

If we substitute $x_1$ for $x$ in the equation, we will get $y_1$.
